intro: Priestleya squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrose priestleya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often found growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Priestleya squarrosa is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
